dt: {bc}the luminous celestial body around which the earth and other planets revolve, from which they receive heat and light, which is composed mainly of hydrogen and helium, and which has a mean distance from earth of about 93,000,000 miles (150,000,000 kilometers), a linear diameter of 864,000 miles (1,390,000 kilometers), and a mass 332,000 times greater than earth
{bc}the heat or light radiated from the sun
{bc}one resembling the sun (as in warmth or brilliance)
{bc}the rising or setting of the sun

et: Middle English {it}sunne{/it}, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}sunna{/it} sun, Latin {it}sol{/it} {ma}{mat|solar|}{/ma}
shortdef: the luminous celestial body around which the earth and other planets revolve, from which they receive heat and light, which is composed mainly of hydrogen and helium, and which has a mean distance from earth of about 93,000,000 miles (150,000,000 kilometers), a linear diameter of 864,000 miles (1,390,000 kilometers), and a mass 332,000 times greater than earth
a celestial body like the sun : star
the heat or light radiated from the sun

dt: {bc}to expose to or as if to the rays of the sun

shortdef: to expose to or as if to the rays of the sun

dt: {bc}a small forest-dwelling bear ({it}Ursus malayanus{/it} synonym {it}Helarctos malayanus{/it}) of southeastern Asia that has short glossy black fur with a lighter muzzle and often an orange or white breast mark

shortdef: a small forest-dwelling bear (Ursus malayanus synonym Helarctos malayanus) of southeastern Asia that has short glossy black fur with a lighter muzzle and often an orange or white breast mark

dt: {bc}a solo or group solstice rite of American Indians

shortdef: a solo or group solstice rite of American Indians

dt: {bc}an ancient Near Eastern symbol consisting of a disk with conventionalized wings emblematic of the sun god (such as Ra in Egypt)

shortdef: an ancient Near Eastern symbol consisting of a disk with conventionalized wings emblematic of the sun god (such as Ra in Egypt)

dt: {bc}a small nearly round halo on the parhelic circle most frequently just outside the halo of 22 degrees

shortdef: a small nearly round halo on the parhelic circle most frequently just outside the halo of 22 degrees

dt: {bc}a god that represents or personifies the sun in various religions

shortdef: a god that represents or personifies the sun in various religions

dt: {bc}a goddess that represents or personifies the sun in various religions

shortdef: a goddess that represents or personifies the sun in various religions

dt: {bc}any of a small family (Heliornithidae) of semiaquatic African, Asian, and American tropical birds that have lobed feet and are related to the rails

shortdef: any of a small family (Heliornithidae) of semiaquatic African, Asian, and American tropical birds that have lobed feet and are related to the rails
